# Basic outline with package and imports

file name=main.go
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	str "strings"
	"os"
)

func main() {
	fmt.Println("hello")
}
----

outline file=main.go
----
package: main
imports:
  fmt
  strings (alias: str)
  os
symbols:
  function main private

# Outline with types and methods

file name=types.go
package mypackage

import "errors"

type Config struct {
	Port int
}

func (c *Config) Validate() error {
	if c.Port == 0 {
		return errors.New("port required")
	}
	return nil
}

func NewConfig(port int) *Config {
	return &Config{Port: port}
}
----

outline file=types.go
----
package: mypackage
imports:
  errors
symbols:
  struct Config public
  method (Config) Validate public
  function NewConfig public

# Outline with interface

file name=iface.go
package api

type Handler interface {
	Handle(req Request) Response
}

type Request struct {
	Body string
}

type Response struct {
	Status int
}
----

outline file=iface.go
----
package: api
symbols:
  interface Handler public
  struct Request public
  struct Response public

# Outline with constants and variables

file name=config.go
package config

const (
	DefaultPort = 8080
	MaxRetries  = 3
)

var (
	Version = "1.0.0"
	debug   = false
)
----

outline file=config.go
----
package: config
symbols:
  const DefaultPort public
  const MaxRetries public
  var Version public
  var debug private

# Empty file with only package

file name=empty.go
package empty
----

outline file=empty.go
----
package: empty

# File with type aliases

file name=aliases.go
package types

type StringMap map[string]string
type Handler func(string) error
type IntSlice []int
----

outline file=aliases.go
----
package: types
symbols:
  type StringMap public
  type Handler public
  type IntSlice public
